result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel R Gallardo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - County Ordinance. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at $25.00 per month commencing 9/1/16 and the 1st of every month until paid in full or penalty of 4 days jail for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Grant Scaife appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Daniel R Gallardo in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.  
Jury Trial Cancelled.

State moves to amend count 1 to a county ordinance DC.
Defense has no objections.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to the amended charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended charge.
Count 2 is dismissed as a read in.
 

Court orders the following:
Fine:  $267.50
To be paid at the rate of $25 per month, starting 09/01/16  and the 1st of every month until paid in full.
Alternate:  4 Days in the Waukesha County Jail.

Jury status hearing on July 6, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on July 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
